TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit CodePrimitiveExpression extends System.CodeDom.CodeExpression

Docs.summary: Represents a primitive data type value.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.CodeDom.CodePrimitiveExpression> can be used to represent an expression that indicates a primitive data type value.
The <xref:System.CodeDom.CodePrimitiveExpression.Value%2A> property specifies the primitive data type value to represent.
Primitive data types that can be represented using <xref:System.CodeDom.CodePrimitiveExpression> include `null`; string; 16-, 32-, and 64-bit signed integers; and single-precision and double-precision floating-point numbers.
## Examples The following example demonstrates use of <xref:System.CodeDom.CodePrimitiveExpression> to represent values of several primitive types.
[!code-cpp[CodePrimitiveExpressionExample#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_CLR/CodePrimitiveExpressionExample/CPP/codeprimitiveexpressionexample.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[CodePrimitiveExpressionExample#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CLR/CodePrimitiveExpressionExample/CS/codeprimitiveexpressionexample.cs#2)] [!code-vb[CodePrimitiveExpressionExample#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CLR/CodePrimitiveExpressionExample/VB/codeprimitiveexpressionexample.vb#2)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class using the specified object.
Gets or sets the primitive data type to represent.
Docs.value: The primitive data type instance to represent the value of.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Any .NET Framework primitive type can be used here.
